intro: Tithymalus cornutus, commonly known as the horned tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, branched, and often hairy stems that give it a unique appearance. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are usually pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. Tithymalus cornutus is native to parts of Europe and is often found in meadows and grassy areas.
